page.title: 13Interesting places
page.content: Looking at our map we discoved The Pest House. Why was it so called? It is believed to have been built originally as an isolation hospital for the village and the date over the door was 1767. The place eventually became part of Lordship Farm and was occupied by farm labourers until 1914. On some Ordnance survey maps it is shown as Bush Wood Cottage. The Pest House lies across the fields, in the centre of a wood, behind The Lordship.Very little of it remains today.At one time coal was delivered once a year and water had to be lugged over from Lordship Farm unless the land-drains were full. The open fireplace is still to be seen there but generally the house is in ruins but we thought that it was very interesting to learn that such a place had once existed.
